doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: AthapattuMudiyanselagePriyadarshani Nishanthi Athapattu vs Balasuriya Arachchige Mahinda KarunaratnaPerera before Hon. R. Gurusinghe, J.
latest_doc_d.parties: AthapattuMudiyanselagePriyadarshani Nishanthi Athapattu vs Balasuriya Arachchige Mahinda KarunaratnaPerera
latest_doc_d.keywords: Jurisdiction of the Court of Appeal to review the judgments or orders of the Provincial High Court
latest_doc_d.legistation: Article 138 and Article 154P of the Constitution High Court of the Provinces (Special Provinces) Act No. 19 of 1990
